text: Henry Styles Bridges (September 9, 1898November 26, 1961) was an American teacher, editor, and Republican Party politician. He was the 63rd Governor of New Hampshire before a twenty-four-year career in the United States Senate. Bridges died of a heart attack in Concord, New Hampshire on November 26, 1961 at the age of 63.Kiepper, Yankee Senator, 231-3 ==References== ==Other websites== * Biographic Sketch at U.S. Congress website * Styles at New Hampshire's Division of Historic Resources * "N.H. should reassess legacy of Senator Styles Bridges," Boston Globe, December 29, 2012 Category:1898 births Category:1961 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Educators from Maine Category:Minority leaders of the United States Senate Category:Governors of New Hampshire Category:United States senators from New Hampshire Category:Presidents pro tempore of the United States Senate Category:Politicians from Maine Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Educators from New Hampshire
title: Styles Bridges
